bibl.title: The Sixth Book of the Select Letters of Severus, Patriarch of Antioch in the Syriac Version of Athanasius of Nisibis
Translation, I.1 - II.3
To Peter, Bishop of Apamea

category.catDesc: Used to denote a date calculated by the editor from a regnal year or some other dating method given in the text.

person.persName: The religious presbyter Thomas of Antioch

occupation.note: Thomas was a presbyter in Antioch .

nationality.note: Irenaeus was a citizen of Emesa.
Anatolius was a citizen of Tarsus.

event.desc: Between 514 and 518, Severuswrote a letter toPeter ofApamea, hoping to correct the bishop's views of ordinations that occur at the hands of those outside a particular diocese.

event.ana: http://syriaca.org/keyword/ordination http://syriaca.org/keyword/letters http://syriaca.org/keyword/canon-law http://syriaca.org/keyword/tradition http://syriaca.org/keyword/anathema http://syriaca.org/keyword/polemics http://syriaca.org/keyword/clergy http://syriaca.org/keyword/priests http://syriaca.org/keyword/bishops
event.desc: Severuswas aware of many letters written byPeterto himself and to the presbyterThomas, wherein Peteraccused Severusand others of breaking canon-law and tradition by allowing for ordinations outside of the diocese.

Severusdefended his ordination practices by pointing out that many other godly bishops approved, includingJulian, who allowedSeverusto ordain the deaconIrenaeus, andDionysius, who allowedSeverusto ordain the deaconAnatolius.
Contrary to the opinion ofPeter, Severushad not ordainedLeontiusout of need, but in order to honour the man.
Severushad become acquainted withLeontiusthrough letters while living inPalestine.
In his letter, Peterreported toSeverusthatLeontiushad shaken the stability of the Church inApamea.
SeverusencouragedPeterto ordain the scholastics John son of MatronianandSergius.
Severusintended to ordain the scholastics PeterandMaximin.

bibl.title: The Sixth Book of the Select Letters of Severus, Patriarch of Antioch in the Syriac Version of Athanasius of Nisibis
Translation, I.1 - II.3
